title: Scary LOOKING champions
body:
#**We don't have is even a single character with scary VISUALS.** 

That _isn't_ to say that every character who's scary in the lore needs to look scary. Jhin is a human, so of course it's fine that he looks human. Evelynn lures her victims with sex appeal, so of course she looks sexy. That's not what I'm talking about. 

We're lacking a character for which the visuals alone give a sense of fear, without the need for the voice or knowledge of their background. Urgot _used_ to be scary before his VU, but now he looks more cool than scary. Cho'gath _could_ be scary if his model and animations weren't so stilted. 

As it stands, there are no champions who actually look scary. 
*****
I want to stress that I'm referring to the kind of scary that could scare you with its presence without the need to simply be large and imposing. A huge guy with an axe and an unpleasant look on his face is scary by default, but only because of the harm you know he can do with that axe due to his size. There are plenty of large, imposing champions in the game that don't give off a sense of fear. 
I'm also not referring to the idea behind visuals, but the actual visuals involved. Sure, the idea of being ground to mincemeat is terrifying. But the visual of your model simply being pulled to Urgot's and disappearing is not. 
Likewise, I'm not referring to the fear involved in being helpless during the game. When Urgot's ult suppresses you, you're afraid because you know you're going to die and can't do anything about it. Not because you're given a gory visual that makes you feel the pain. 

I can think of over a dozen small changes that could be made to champions to change them from cool or goofy to truly horrifying.

> [{quoted}](name=JoeAnarchy,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=XB1ou6jA,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2018-10-06T05:12:39.386+0000)
>
> {{champion:6}} is nightmare fuel..

*was

Old Urgot was nightmare fuel. If he still looked like that, or looked like an updated version of the stitched-together, decaying flesh of the old model, you'd have a point. But current Urgot doesn't look frightening so much as he looks freaking badass.

I don't know, getting ulted by Urgot is one of the most terrifying experiences in the game. Way scarier than anything old Urgot had to offer. At the very least I feel like Urgot's gameplay is true to his scary nature.

Old Urgot wasn't that scary. Like yeah, he was stitched together flesh, but so is current Urgot to an extent. Old Urgot just looked bad in-game, so he was never going to be nightmare fuel as-is.

Now personally, I think Urgot’s rework was about 75% successful for what I wanted to see from his rework. And that is just about all to do with his ability animations.  The ult especially is as you say, pretty awesome. The chains shooting out, then the stuttering jerk of your character as it gets dragged into a meat grinder. That’s brutal. 

But the actual design of Urgot the character. Meh. I agree with OP on that one. The old Urgot (despite looking shit because he was an old model) had a pretty disturbed aesthetic. Literally stitched together, you could see pipes and mechanics ripping out of his skin. Which gave him this horrifying mechanical zombie feel. 

New Urgot has a scar that you can’t even see most the time. They traded horror for might. He looks like a tough thug. A mix of Bane from The Dark Knight Rises and that silly spider guy from Wild Wild West. 

It works. I know probably more people will want to play him now. But for me. I’d rather have the grotesque.

Urgot remained scary, but he turned from being the last true grotesque in LoL to another intimidating brutish figure. Like Sion.

> [{quoted}](name=CIayman,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=XB1ou6jA,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2018-10-06T05:00:10.510+0000)

>

Thank you for actually bringing up something worth discussing. It really is difficult for them to make anything scary, especially given the style they now have. People have brought up Urgot, but Urgot _used to be_ scary. He's just plain not any more. He does look fantastic, but it isn't scary. 

A lot of the fear aspect in this game comes from the imposing power of champions, not anything truly terrifying. A massive guy with an axe is scary in a way just because you know you can't overpower him. The same way a monster truck barreling at you is scary.

I don't think Riot can make champions and their abilities overly scary/graphic, as it may affect the rating of the game. Hell, I personally think some of the stuff in the game already is pushing it a bit. Urgot pulls you into a fucking meat grinder FFS. That is brutal.

And, back to Jhin's alternate color story that I mentioned in the now deleted thread, I believe the reason why they scrapped it was because it was so graphic that it would've risked changing the rating of the entire game.

So, be it in lore or in game, the representation of a scary champion needs to be watered down a bit to prevent the rating of the game being changed.

> [{quoted}](name=4 Step Cadence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=XB1ou6jA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2018-10-06T03:04:11.430+0000)

> 
> So, be it in lore or in game, the representation of a scary champion needs to be watered down a bit to prevent the rating of the game being changed.

To say Urgot's ultimate is brutal because of the _idea_ behind it, despite the fact the visuals don't actually have any gore, is to claim that people being burned to ashes by Annie, cleaved in half by Darius, poisoned to death by Teemo, bludgeoned to death by Jax, and eaten by Fizz's Shark is somehow not brutal. Which doesn't stand to scrutiny. Plain and simple, for the same reasons all of these methods aren't brutal-- that being that the visuals aren't graphic in this game-- Urgot is not brutal, either. He simply pulls your model to his and your model disappears.

The reason why I used Urgot as an example was because you said he seems more cool now than scary after his VGU, which I disagree with. Granted I didn't really see Urgot at all before his VGU, since I had just joined not too long before it and I didn't own him at the time. However, from the few times I saw him in game, I didn't really find him scary. I found him to be more ugly than anything due to his outdated model and such. He seems far more intimidating and powerful now.

> [{quoted}](name=4 Step Cadence,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=XB1ou6jA,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-06T06:26:02.044+0000)
>
> The reason why I used Urgot as an example was because you said he seems more cool now than scary after his VGU, which I disagree with. Granted I didn't really see Urgot at all before his VGU, since I had just joined not too long before it and I didn't own him at the time. However, from the few times I saw him in game, I didn't really find him scary. I found him to be more ugly than anything due to his outdated model and such. He seems far more intimidating and powerful now.

I did say in another comment that he could have been scary if they'd kept the decaying and stitched-together flesh, but simply updated it. One thing I'm trying to stress is that _powerful_ does not equate to _frightening._ By default, a huge guy with an axe coming at you with an unfreindly expression is going to be a kind of scary, but not the kind that gives you nightmares from the visual. If you have nightmares, it will be about the possible outcome of being chopped to bits. 

There are plenty of powerful champions in League. They're strong. They're _imposing._ But they aren't _terrifying._

I don't find the stitched, decaying flesh to be scary, because it gives you the impression that they are, in fact, rotting and in a sense would most likely be fragile and easy to kill.

The reason why I find power and intimidation more scary is because characters like that give you the impression that they are hard to kill, and very capable of killing you. A stitched up decaying monstrosity doesn't seem scary to be because there's no real intimidation there. Is he big? Sure, but he's also pretty much falling apart. It may be unsettling at first, but once you realize how fragile he is, its really not anymore.

I suppose it is more of a manner of opinion and personal fears/horror preferences. I, for one, am afraid of Nocturne. Something about the way he moves in game is just unsettling to me. I am also terrified of the dark and being alone, so watching the map go dark when I'm by myself is not something that I enjoy.

You do bring up a fair point. But I don't think it's completely true. Old Urgot was scary even just with the model. If they had actually kept him dead and kept the decaying flesh and sewn-together pieces, he could've kept what made him scary. 

As for Thresh, I can't agree. We actually have an example of Thresh that is very close to real-- Ghost Rider. A flaming skeleton who uses a chain to drag his enemies to hell, and while Nicolas Cage was a god awful choice for the casting (why the hell didn't they just use the same actor they used for young Johnny?), the parts where he's Ghostrider are well animated. But even then, it didn't look all that scary. 

And another thing, I really wanted to stress that the _idea_ of a champion is very different from the execution of their visuals. In this game, all Urgot does with his ultimate is drag your unmoving model to his and makes it disappear while gears do a grinding motion. That is completely different from actually showing each champion's blood, guts, and bones being ground down to mince meat.
